fields.headline: Yesterday
fields.bodyText: Bad day Morley Conservative Club in West Yorkshire. Members were not amused by the two billboard posters slapped on the side of the building - two 25ft x 10ft Labour posters each carrying the words "Tory cuts" in huge black letters. Slip of the day Defence procurement minister Lady Symons told peers that one of three contenders for a new radio contract would be chosen "during the course of the summer". She added: "I hope that whoever happens to be minister at that point would then be able to conclude the contract very quickly." Not expecting a post-election reshuffle then? Today Commons: Backbench bills. High hedges bill, copyright, etc and trade marks (offences and enforcement) bill, pension annuities (amendment) bill, second readings. Lords: Wild mammals (protection) (amendment) bill. Debate on EU enlargement and external frontier controls.
